<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The total grant date fair value of options that vested during
    2008 was $10.6&#160;million. The aggregate intrinsic value of
    stock options exercised during 2008, 2007, and 2006 was
    $0.1&#160;million, $0.9&#160;million, and $2.9&#160;million,
    respectively. As of January&#160;31, 2009, there was
    $3.2&#160;million of unrecognized compensation cost, net of
    estimated forfeitures, related to stock options that are
    expected to vest. These costs are expected to be recognized over
    a weighted average period of 1.4&#160;years.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-22
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Nonvested
    Stock Awards and RSUs</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A summary of nonvested stock awards and RSU activity for the
    year ended January&#160;31, 2009 is presented below. The fair
    value of nonvested stock awards and RSUs granted are based on
    the closing traded stock price on the date of the grant.
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The intrinsic value of nonvested stock awards and RSUs that
    vested during 2008, 2007 and 2006 was $4.3&#160;million,
    $1.6&#160;million, and $3.5&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of January&#160;31, 2009, there was $14.4&#160;million of
    unrecognized compensation cost, net of estimated forfeitures,
    related to nonvested stock awards and RSUs that are expected to
    vest. These costs are expected to be recognized over a weighted
    average period of 1.9&#160;years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">8.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Related
    Party and Affiliates</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    AEON is a related party that owns and operates Talbots brand
    stores in Japan through its wholly owned subsidiary, Talbots
    Japan Co., Ltd. (&#147;Talbots Japan&#148;). The Company
    provides certain services and purchases merchandise for Talbots
    Japan. The Company is reimbursed for expenses incurred and the
    cost of merchandise. For the years ended January&#160;31, 2009,
    February&#160;2, 2008, and February&#160;3, 2007, the total
    charges for services and merchandise purchases were
    $4.4&#160;million, $14.8&#160;million, and $17.0&#160;million,
    respectively. At January&#160;31, 2009 and February&#160;2,
    2008, the Company was owed $0.4&#160;million and
    $3.0&#160;million respectively, for these service costs and for
    merchandise inventory purchases made on behalf of Talbots Japan.
    Interest at a rate equal to the Internal Revenue Service monthly
    short-term applicable federal rate accrues on amounts
    outstanding more than 30&#160;days after the original invoice
    date. In July 2008, Talbots Japan became current on their
    outstanding invoices, therefore eliminating the interest
    calculation for invoices outstanding past
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">30-days.</FONT> As
    of February&#160;2, 2008 and February&#160;3, 2007, the
    applicable interest rate was 3.1% and 4.8%, respectively. During
    2008, 2007, and 2006, the Company charged Talbots Japan interest
    of less than $0.1&#160;million, $0.1&#160;million, and
    $0.2&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company has an advisory services agreement with AEON
    (U.S.A.) under which AEON provides advice and services to the
    Company with respect to strategic planning and other related
    issues concerning the Company. Additionally, AEON (U.S.A.)
    maintains on behalf of the Company, a working relationship with
    Japanese banks and other financial institutions. AEON (U.S.A.)
    receives an annual fee of $0.25&#160;million plus any expenses
    incurred, which were not material. At January&#160;31, 2009 and
    February&#160;2, 2008, there were no amounts owed under this
    contract. The Company also provides tax and accounting services
    to AEON (U.S.A.) which are immaterial in amount.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In July 2008, the Company entered into a $50.0&#160;million
    unsecured subordinated working capital term loan facility with
    AEON (U.S.A.). The working capital term loan credit facility
    will mature and AEON (U.S.A.)&#146;s commitment to provide
    borrowings under the facility will expire on January&#160;28,
    2012. As of January&#160;31, 2009, the Company had
    $20.0&#160;million in borrowings outstanding under this
    $50.0&#160;million credit facility. Interest accrued at
    January&#160;31, 2009 and interest expense recorded in 2008 was
    less than $0.1&#160;million. See further discussion at
    Note&#160;12, <I>Debt</I>.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-23
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In February 2009, the Company entered into a $200.0&#160;million
    term loan agreement with AEON. The funds received from the term
    loan were used to repay all of the outstanding indebtedness
    under the Acquisition Term Loan Agreement. See further
    discussion at Note&#160;12, <I>Debt</I>.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In February 2009, AEON guaranteed the Company&#146;s outstanding
    debt under its existing working capital facilities totaling
    $165&#160;million, its existing revolving credit facilities
    totaling $80&#160;million, and its existing $20&#160;million
    term loan facility. In April 2009 AEON also agreed (i)&#160;that
    it would agree to continue to provide a guaranty for a
    refinancing of any of that debt, which currently matures at
    various dates on and before April&#160;16, 2010 and (ii)&#160;if
    the lender failed to agree to refinance that debt on or before
    the existing maturity date, or if any other condition occurred
    that required AEON to make a payment under its existing
    guaranty, AEON would make a loan to the Company, due on or after
    April&#160;16, 2010 and within the limits of AEON&#146;s
    existing loan guaranty, to avoid any lack of the Company&#146;s
    financial resources caused by any such failure of refinancing.
    In April 2009 AEON also confirmed its support for the
    Company&#146;s working capital improvements initiatives for its
    merchandise payables management and that it will use
    commercially reasonable effort to provide the Company with
    financial support through loan or guarantee up to
    $25&#160;million only if, and to the extent that, the Company
    may possibly fall short in achieving its targeted cash flow
    improvement for fall 2009 merchandise payables.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In April of 2009 the Company entered into a $150&#160;million
    secured revolving loan facility with AEON. The facility matures
    upon the earlier of (i)&#160;April&#160;17, 2010 or
    (ii)&#160;one or more securitization programs or structured
    loans by the Company or its subsidiaries in an aggregate
    equivalent principal amount to the revolving loan commitment
    amount, approved in advance by AEON and in form and substance
    satisfactory to the lender. Funding under this facility is
    subject to mortgage and lien recordings and all necessary
    consents or waivers by existing lenders to the transactions
    contemplated by the agreement, including the granting of liens
    and mortgages in favor of AEON under the facility, without such
    lender requiring prepayment of its indebtedness or the
    establishment of a pari passu lien on the collateral in favor of
    such lender. Amounts may be borrowed, repaid, and reborrowed
    under the facility and may be used for working capital and other
    general corporate purposes. Interest on outstanding borrowings
    is at a variable rate at one month LIBOR plus 6.0% payable
    monthly in arrears. The facility contains an upfront fee of 1.0%
    of the commitment. The facility is secured by the Company&#146;s
    Talbots charge card accounts receivable, its Hingham,
    Massachusetts owned corporate headquarters, and its Lakeville,
    Massachusetts owned distribution facility.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Finance charge income (including interest and late fee income)
    during 2008, 2007, and 2006 was $44.9&#160;million,
    $41.8&#160;million, and $42.4&#160;million, respectively.

    F-24

    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">12.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>

    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Debt</FONT></B>
</TD>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A summary of outstanding debt is as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Acquisition Debt&#160;&#151; </I></B>In February 2006, the
    Company entered into a $400.0&#160;million bridge loan agreement
    in connection with its planned acquisition of J. Jill. On
    July&#160;27, 2006, the bridge loan was converted into a term
    loan (the &#147;Acquisition Debt&#148;). Pursuant to the
    Acquisition Debt agreement, the Company borrowed
    $400.0&#160;million to be repaid no later than July&#160;27,
    2011. The Acquisition Debt was a senior unsecured obligation of
    the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Acquisition Debt bore interest at a rate per annum equal to
    LIBOR plus 0.35% and was required to be repaid in quarterly
    installments of $20.0&#160;million through July&#160;27, 2011.
    The Acquisition Debt agreement included provisions which define
    events of default upon the occurrence of which the repayment of
    the Acquisition Debt could be accelerated. The agreement
    contained covenants restricting a change in control in which
    AEON (U.S.A.), a wholly-owned subsidiary of AEON and the
    majority shareholder of the Company, is no longer the majority
    shareholder, liens and encumbrances, sale and leaseback
    transactions, mergers, consolidations, sales of assets,
    incurrence of indebtedness and guaranties, investments and
    prepayment of subordinated indebtedness. The interest rate on
    the Acquisition Debt at January&#160;31, 2009 was 1.5%. As of
    January&#160;31, 2009, the Company was not in compliance with
    all of its financial covenants. In February 2009, the Company
    entered into a $200.0&#160;million term loan agreement with AEON
    (&#147;AEON Loan&#148;). The funds received from the AEON Loan
    were used to repay all of the outstanding indebtedness under the
    Acquisition Term Loan Agreement in February 2009. As the Company
    had the intent and ability to refinance their Acquisition Debt,
    as evidenced by the February 2009 transaction, the entire
    outstanding balance of this debt has been classified as a
    long-term obligation in the balance sheet as of January&#160;31,
    2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The AEON Loan is an interest only loan until maturity without
    any scheduled principal payments prior to maturity. Interest on
    the AEON Loan is at a variable rate equal to LIBOR plus 6.00%
    (LIBOR is the six month London interbank offer rate expressed as
    a percentage rate per annum). Interest on the AEON Loan is
    payable semi-
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-26
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    annually in arrears. No loan facility fee is payable as part of
    the AEON Loan. The AEON Loan matures on August&#160;31, 2009,
    provided that Talbots will have the option to extend the
    maturity for additional six month periods, up to the third
    anniversary of the loan closing date, which is February&#160;27,
    2012. The AEON Loan is subject to mandatory prepayment as
    follows: (a)&#160;50% of excess cash flow (as defined in the
    agreement), (b)&#160;100% of net cash proceeds of any sale of J.
    Jill and 75% of net cash proceeds on any asset sales or
    dispositions, and (c)&#160;100% of net cash proceeds of any non
    related party debt issuances and 50% of net cash proceeds of any
    equity issuances (subject to such exceptions as to debt or
    equity issuances as the lender may agree to). The AEON Loan may
    be voluntarily prepaid, in whole or in part, at par plus accrued
    and unpaid interest and any break funding loss incurred upon not
    less than three business days&#146; prior written notice, at the
    option of the Company at any time. Upon any voluntary or
    mandatory prepayment, the Company will reimburse the lender for
    costs associated with early termination of any currency hedging
    arrangements related to the loan. Under the terms of the AEON
    Loan agreement, the Company may not incur, assume, guarantee or
    otherwise become or remain liable with respect to any
    indebtedness other than permitted indebtedness as defined in the
    agreement. Written consent of the lender in its discretion will
    be required prior to incurrence of indebtedness, liens,
    fundamental changes including mergers and consolidations,
    dispositions of property including sales of stock of
    subsidiaries, dividends and other restricted payments,
    investments, transactions with affiliates and other related
    parties, sale leaseback transactions, swap agreements, changes
    in fiscal periods, negative pledge clauses, and clauses
    restricting subsidiary distributions, all on terms set forth in
    the agreement. The Company is also limited in its ability to
    purchase or make commitments for capital expenditures in excess
    of amounts approved by AEON. The AEON Loan contains no financial
    covenant ratios.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Revolving Credit Agreements&#160;&#151; </I></B>As of
    January&#160;31, 2009, the Company had revolving credit
    agreements with three banks (the &#147;Revolving Credit
    Agreements&#148;) that provide for maximum available borrowings
    of $80.0&#160;million, and can be extended annually upon mutual
    agreement. Interest terms on the unsecured Revolving Credit
    Agreements are fixed, at the Company&#146;s option, for periods
    of one, three, or six months. As of January&#160;31, 2009, the
    weighted average interest rate on the loans was 3.1%. Of the
    $80.0&#160;million outstanding under the Revolving Credit
    Agreements at January&#160;31, 2009, $28.0&#160;million is due
    in December 2009, $34.0&#160;million is due in January 2010, and
    $18.0&#160;million is due in April 2010. These loans may be
    extended upon approval from the banks.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Term Loan&#160;&#151; </I></B>As of January&#160;31, 2009,
    the Company had a $20.0&#160;million term loan outstanding with
    a bank that matures in April 2012. Interest on the term loan is
    due every six months and was fixed at 5.8% through April 2008,
    and is fixed at 5.9% for the remaining interest periods through
    April 2012.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Related Party Term Loan with AEON (U.S.A.)&#160;&#151;
    </I></B>In July 2008, the Company finalized the terms of a
    $50.0&#160;million unsecured subordinated working capital term
    loan credit facility with AEON (U.S.A.) (the &#147;AEON
    Facility&#148;). The AEON Facility will mature and AEON
    (U.S.A.)&#146;s commitment to provide borrowings under the AEON
    Facility will expire on January&#160;28, 2012. Under the terms
    of the AEON Facility, the financing is the unsecured general
    obligation of the Company and is subordinated to the
    Company&#146;s other financial institution indebtedness existing
    as of the closing date, including under the existing Acquisition
    Debt. The AEON Facility is available for use by the Company and
    its subsidiaries for general working capital and other
    appropriate general corporate purposes. Interest on outstanding
    principal under the AEON Facility will be at a rate equal to
    three-month LIBOR plus 5.0% (6.125% at January&#160;31, 2009).
    The Company was required to pay an upfront commitment fee of
    1.5% (or $0.8&#160;million) to AEON (U.S.A.) at the time of
    execution and closing of the loan credit facility agreement. The
    Company is required to pay a fee of 0.5% per annum on the
    undrawn portion of the commitment, payable quarterly in arrears.
    The AEON Facility had originally included covenants relating to
    the Company and its subsidiaries that were substantially the
    same in all material respects as under the Acquisition Debt. In
    March 2009, an amendment was executed between the Company and
    AEON (U.S.A.) to remove the financial covenants in their
    entirety from the facility. As of January&#160;31, 2009, the
    Company had $20.0&#160;million in borrowings outstanding under
    the AEON Facility.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Working Capital Lines of Credit (Notes payable to
    banks)&#160;&#151; </I></B>In March 2008, the Company increased
    its availability under its short-term working capital line of
    credit facility by $25.0&#160;million, from $140.0&#160;million
    to
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-27
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    $165.0&#160;million. In December 2008, three of the four banks
    holding the lines entered into credit agreements with the
    Company to convert their lines, covering $75.0&#160;million,
    $50.0&#160;million, and $25.0&#160;million, respectively, from
    uncommitted lines to committed lines. Additionally, in February
    2009, the fourth bank entered into a credit agreement with the
    Company to convert its line, covering $15.0&#160;million, from
    an uncommitted line to a committed line. The lines are committed
    through December 2009. Each borrowing bears interest for
    interest periods of six months or less as mutually established
    by the Company and the respective lenders, with such interest
    payable on the last day of each interest period or, in the event
    that the interest period exceeds three months, three months
    after the first day of the interest period. The interest rate is
    a rate determined by the respective lenders to be their
    effective cost of funds plus an amount not lower than 0.6% and
    not higher than 1.3%. Amounts may be borrowed under the above
    facilities from time to time, subject to satisfaction of all
    conditions to borrowing set forth in the respective agreements,
    including without limitation accuracy of all representations and
    warranties, the absence of any material adverse effect or
    change, no event of default, compliance with all covenants, and
    other customary borrowing conditions. At January&#160;31, 2009
    and February&#160;2, 2008, the Company had $148.5&#160;million
    and $0.0&#160;million, respectively, outstanding under these
    facilities. In the fourth quarter of 2008, as a result of the
    Company&#146;s borrowing and repayment patterns, the maturities
    on the lines are no longer short term in nature and accordingly
    have been shown gross on the statement of cash flows. The
    weighted average interest rate was 1.5% at January&#160;31, 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Secured Revolving Loan Facility with AEON&#160;&#151;
    </I></B>In April 2009, the Company entered into a new
    $150&#160;million secured revolving loan facility with AEON.
    Interest under this facility is one month LIBOR plus 6.0%.
    Amounts may be borrowed and reborrowed under the facility. The
    facility matures in April 2010 and does not include any
    financial covenants. The facility may be used for working
    capital and other general corporate purposes, including vendor
    payments. The facility is secured by the Company&#146;s Talbots
    charge card receivables, its corporate facility and its
    distribution facility. The Company has agreed to keep the
    mortgaged properties in good repair, reasonable wear and tear
    expected, and will ensure that at least $135.0&#160;million of
    Talbots charge card receivables are owed to the Company and that
    at least 90% of such Talbots charge card receivables are
    eligible receivables, as defined in the agreement, and arise in
    the ordinary course of business, and are owned free and clear of
    all liens, except permitted liens, measured as of the last day
    of any calendar month. The Company will need to obtain
    AEON&#146;s written consent as lender prior to, among other
    things, incurring indebtedness, fundamental changes (including
    mergers, consolidations, etc.), disposing of property (including
    sales of stock of subsidiaries) payments or investments,
    undertaking transactions with affiliates and other related
    parties, consummating sale leaseback transactions, swap
    agreements, negative pledges, and clauses restricting subsidiary
    distributions and lines of business, all as set forth in the
    agreement. An upfront fee of 1% of the commitment is due upon
    closing. Funding is subject to lien and mortgage recordings and
    certain existing lender consents or waivers and other closing
    conditions set forth in the facility. The facility also provides
    for prepayment and loan maturity in the event the Company were
    to consummate certain qualified transactions, such as
    securitization or sale of its Talbots charge card portfolio or
    certain asset collateralizations. This facility has no financial
    covenants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>AEON Guarantees&#160;&#151; </I></B>In February 2009 AEON
    guaranteed the Company&#146;s outstanding debt under its
    existing working capital facilities totaling $165&#160;million,
    its existing revolving loan facilities totaling
    $80&#160;million, and our existing $20&#160;million term loan
    facility. In April&#160;2009 AEON also agreed (i)&#160;that it
    would agree to continue to provide a guaranty for a refinancing
    of any of that debt, which currently matures at various dates on
    and before April&#160;16, 2010 and (ii)&#160;if the lender
    failed to agree to refinance that debt on or before the existing
    maturity date, or if any other condition occurred that required
    AEON to make a payment under its existing guaranty, AEON would
    make a loan to us, due on or after April&#160;16, 2010 and
    within the limits of AEON&#146;s existing loan guaranty, to
    avoid any lack of our financial resources caused by any such
    failure of refinancing.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Tilton Loan Facility&#160;&#151; </I></B>As part of the J.
    Jill acquisition, the Company assumed a real estate loan (the
    &#147;Tilton Facility Loan&#148;). The Tilton Facility Loan is
    collateralized by a mortgage lien on the operations, fulfillment
    and distribution center in Tilton, New Hampshire (the
    &#147;Tilton Facility&#148;). Payments of principal and interest
    on the Tilton Facility Loan, a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-year</FONT>
    loan, are due monthly, based on a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">20-year</FONT>
    amortization, with a balloon payment of the remaining balance
    payable on June&#160;1, 2009. The interest rate on the Tilton
    Facility Loan is fixed at 7.3% per annum.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-28
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Letters of Credit&#160;&#151; </I></B>At January&#160;31,
    2009, the Company did not have any letter of credit agreements
    outstanding. The Company&#146;s letter of credit agreements of
    $265.0&#160;million held at February&#160;2, 2008, which were
    used primarily for the purchase of merchandise inventories, were
    canceled during 2008. In July 2008, the Company executed an
    addendum to its financing agreement with one bank, allowing the
    Company to utilize its existing $75.0&#160;million short term
    working capital line of credit facility with the bank for
    letters of credit. The $75.0&#160;million short term working
    capital line of credit facility will continue to be available
    for working capital borrowings; however, the capacity will be
    reduced by any commercial letters of credit outstanding. As of
    January&#160;31, 2009, the Company held $16.5&#160;million in
    outstanding letters of credit against the $75.0&#160;million
    short term line of credit facility. At January&#160;31, 2009 and
    February&#160;2, 2008, the Company held $14.8&#160;million and
    $158.4&#160;million outstanding, respectively, of letters of
    credit.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <BR>
    F-29

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    Company&#146;s effective income tax rate is as follows:

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The foreign income inclusion represents a cash distribution from
    the Canadian operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Deferred
    tax assets (liabilities)</FONT></I></B>

</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-30
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    All deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities related to
    the J. Jill business remain in continuing operations as these
    net assets are not expected to be sold with the business.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During the fourth quarter of 2008, the Company experienced
    significant declines in sales which resulted in significant
    losses from continuing and discontinued operations. As a result
    of these significant losses in 2008, the Company has incurred
    cumulative losses as measured by the results from the current
    year and the prior two years. SFAS&#160;No.&#160;109 requires
    that deferred tax assets be reduced by a valuation allowance, if
    based on all available evidence, it is considered more likely
    than not that some portion or all of the recorded deferred tax
    assets will not be realized in a future period. Forming a
    conclusion that a valuation allowance is not needed when
    cumulative losses exist requires a significant amount of
    positive evidence to support recovery. As a result of the
    Company&#146;s evaluation, the Company has concluded that there
    was insufficient positive evidence to overcome the more
    objective negative evidence related to its cumulative losses.
    Accordingly, the Company recorded a valuation allowance in the
    amount of $211.7&#160;million. Of the $211.7&#160;million
    valuation allowance recorded, $61.0&#160;million was recorded in
    continuing operations, $21.3&#160;million was recorded in other
    comprehensive income, and $129.4&#160;million was in
    discontinued operations. The determination of the Company&#146;s
    net deferred tax assets for purposes of determining the
    valuation allowance excludes deferred tax liabilities related to
    the Talbots brand trademarks. Because these tax deductible
    indefinite-lived intangibles are not amortized for book
    purposes, it is inappropriate to assume the reversal of these
    deferred tax liabilities was available to support recovery of
    deferred tax assets.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The valuation allowance on deferred tax assets arising from
    actuarial losses on pension and other postretirement benefits
    during 2008 was included as a component of other comprehensive
    loss. All other components of the valuation allowance, including
    the deferred tax assets related to the beginning of the year
    actuarial losses included in accumulated comprehensive loss,
    were included in continuing operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company did not record a valuation allowance in 2007 or 2006
    as it believed that it was more likely than not that the
    deferred tax assets would be realized.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of January&#160;31, 2009, the Company has approximately
    $84.5&#160;million of gross domestic net operating losses and
    $1.0&#160;million of gross foreign net operating loss carryovers
    that will reduce future taxable income. The federal, state and
    foreign tax effected net operating loss was approximately
    $22.4&#160;million, $8.6&#160;million, and $0.3&#160;million
    respectively. The net operating loss for federal and foreign
    income tax purposes will expire in 2029. The state net operating
    loss carryforwards will expire in 2012 and beyond. The Company
    has alternative minimum tax (&#147;AMT&#148;) credit
    carryforwards of $2.0&#160;million. There is no expiration date
    for the AMT credit carryforwards. Additionally, the Company has
    charitable contribution carryforwards that begin to expire
    in&#160;2012.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Uncertain
    tax positions</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Effective February&#160;4, 2007, the Company adopted the
    provisions of FIN&#160;No 48. FIN&#160;No.&#160;48 clarifies the
    accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in the
    financial statements by prescribing a recognition threshold and
    measurement attribute for recognition and measurement of a tax
    position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. In
    accordance with FIN&#160;No.&#160;48, the Company has classified
    uncertain tax positions as non-current income tax liabilities
    unless expected to be paid in one year. The Company has
    classified uncertain tax positions expected to be paid in one
    year within accrued liabilities. Upon the adoption of
    FIN&#160;No.&#160;48, the Company has elected to classify
    interest on uncertain tax positions in interest expense,
    interest income from income tax refunds in other interest
    income, and penalties in selling, general and administrative
    expenses. Previously, these amounts were reflected in income tax
    expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As a result of the adoption of FIN&#160;No.&#160;48, as of
    February&#160;4, 2007, the Company recognized a
    $4.7&#160;million increase in its reserve related to uncertain
    tax positions which was recorded as a reduction to the
    February&#160;4, 2007 balance of retained earnings.
    Additionally, the Company recorded an increase in deferred tax
    assets of $24.0&#160;million, a corresponding increase in the
    reserve related to uncertain tax positions of
    $18.6&#160;million, and an increase in accrued tax related
    interest of $5.4&#160;million related primarily to federal tax
    benefits associated with certain state tax and interest reserves
    and temporary differences.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-31
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of January&#160;31, 2009 and February&#160;2, 2008, the
    Company had unrecognized tax benefits of approximately
    $38.5&#160;million and $37.9&#160;million, respectively, of
    which $38.5&#160;million and $37.9&#160;million, respectively,
    if recognized, would impact the effective tax rate. As of
    January&#160;31, 2009, and February&#160;2, 2008, the total
    amount of accrued tax-related interest and penalties included in
    other liabilities was as follows: tax-related interest of
    $20.0&#160;million and $17.7&#160;million, respectively, and
    penalties of $4.4&#160;million and $3.4&#160;million,
    respectively. The amounts of tax-related interest and penalties
    accrued during 2008 were $2.3&#160;million and
    $1.0&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company is subject to U.S.&#160;federal income tax as well
    as income tax in multiple state and foreign jurisdictions. The
    Company has closed all U.S.&#160;federal income tax matters for
    years through 2004. Currently, tax years beginning in 1993
    remain open to examination by various state and foreign taxing
    jurisdictions. The Company anticipates a reduction in its
    unrecognized tax benefits of approximately $12.6&#160;million
    within the next twelve months due to various expected state
    audit settlements and appeal decisions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"><!-- TABLE 05 -->

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">14.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Segment
    and Geographic Information</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company has segmented its operations in a manner that
    reflects how its chief operating decision-maker reviews the
    results of the operating segments that comprise the consolidated
    entity. The Company considers its operating segments to be
    similar in terms of economic characteristics, purchasing
    processes, and operations, and has aggregated them into two
    reporting segments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s &#147;Stores Segment&#148; includes the
    Company&#146;s Talbots retail store operations in the United
    States and Canada. The Company&#146;s &#147;Direct Marketing
    Segment&#148; includes catalog and Internet operations for the
    Talbots brand.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s reporting segments offer similar products;
    however, each segment requires different marketing and
    management strategies. The Stores Segment derives its revenues
    from the sale of women&#146;s apparel, accessories and shoes
    through its retail stores, while the Direct Marketing Segment
    derives its revenues through its approximately 22 distinct
    catalog mailings per year, and online at www.talbots.com.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company evaluates the operating performance of its
    identified segments based on a direct profit measure. The
    accounting policies of the segments are generally the same as
    those described in the summary of significant accounting
    policies, except as follows: direct profit is calculated as net
    sales less cost of goods sold and direct expenses, such as
    payroll, occupancy and other direct costs. Indirect expenses are
    not allocated on a segment basis; therefore, no measure of
    segment net income or loss is available. Indirect expenses
    consist of general and administrative expenses such as corporate
    costs and management information systems and support, finance
    charge income, merchandising costs, costs of oversight of the
    Company&#146;s Talbots charge card operations, certain general
    warehousing costs, depreciation related to corporate held
    assets, and corporate-wide restructuring charges. Assets, with
    the exception of goodwill and other intangible assets, are not
    allocated between segments; therefore, no measure of segment
    assets is available. For purposes of assessing impairment on an
    annual basis, the Company is required to allocate its goodwill
    and indefinite lived intangible assets to its reporting
    segments. The Company has
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-32
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    allocated its entire $35.5&#160;million of goodwill to its
    Stores Segment. The Company has allocated $64.5&#160;million of
    indefinite lived trademarks to its Stores Segment and
    $11.4&#160;million to its Direct Marketing segment. There have
    been no changes to the Company&#146;s goodwill and trademark
    balances during 2008, 2007, or 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following is certain segment information for 2008, 2007, and
    2006:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The remaining depreciation and amortization expense of
    $12.6&#160;million, $13.6&#160;million, and $13.4&#160;million
    was included within indirect expenses during 2008, 2007, and
    2006, respectively.
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As a retailer that sells to the general public, the Company has
    no single customer who accounts for greater than 10% of the
    Company&#146;s consolidated net sales.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-33

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">15.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Benefit
    Plans</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company sponsors a non-contributory defined benefit pension
    plan (&#147;Pension Plan&#148;) covering substantially all
    Talbots brand and shared service salaried and hourly employees
    in the United States of America, hired on or before
    December&#160;31, 2007. Eligible employees were enrolled in the
    pension plan after one year of service (with at least
    1,000&#160;hours worked) and reaching age&#160;21. Employee
    benefits vest over five years. The benefit formula for salaried
    and hourly corporate employees is a final average pay benefit
    formula and the benefit formula for store employees is a career
    pay formula. During 2007, the Company elected to close
    participation in the Plan for all associates hired after
    December&#160;31, 2007. In February 2009, the Company announced
    its decision to discontinue future benefits being earned under
    the Pension Plan effective May&#160;1, 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In prior years, the Company used December&#160;31st&#160;as its
    measurement date for obligation and asset calculations. In 2008,
    in accordance with SFAS&#160;No.&#160;158, the measurement date
    became the fiscal year end date of the Company and, as such, the
    plans were valued as of January&#160;31, 2009. Due to the
    adoption of the measurement provisions of
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;158, the Company recorded a decrease of
    approximately $0.9&#160;million to retained earnings. As a
    result of the decision made in February 2009 to freeze the
    Pension Plan, a remeasurement will occur in 2009 using new
    assumptions. Pension Plan assets consist principally of equity,
    fixed income securities and foreign equity investments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company has two unfunded, non-qualified supplemental
    executive retirement plans (collectively, the &#147;SERP&#148;)
    for certain Talbots brand key executives impacted by Internal
    Revenue Code limits on benefits and certain Talbots brand
    current and former key executives who defer compensation into
    the Company&#146;s Deferred Compensation Plan. In prior years,
    the Company used December&#160;31st&#160;as its measurement date
    for obligation and asset calculations. In 2008, in accordance
    with SFAS&#160;No.&#160;158, the measurement date became the
    fiscal year end date of the Company and, as such, the plans were
    valued as of January&#160;31, 2009. Due to the adoption of the
    measurement provisions of SFAS&#160;No.&#160;158, the Company
    recorded a decrease of approximately $0.1&#160;million to
    retained earnings. As a result of the decision made in February
    2009 to freeze benefits accrued under the SERP, a remeasurement
    will occur using new assumptions. Under the Company&#146;s
    CEO&#146;s original employment agreement entered into upon her
    2007 hiring, the executive has a contractual right to an
    equivalent replacement benefit in the event of a material
    reduction or termination of the SERP.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Retirees are eligible for certain limited postretirement health
    care benefits (&#147;Postretirement Medical Plan&#148;) if they
    have met certain service and minimum age requirements.
    Additionally, three Talbots brand, current and former, executive
    officers of the Company participate in a separate executive
    postretirement medical plan
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-34
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (&#147;Executive Postretirement Medical Plan&#148;). Together,
    these plans are referred to as the Postretirement Medical Plans.
    Under the Executive Postretirement Medical Plan, the
    participants and their eligible dependents are not required to
    pay deductible or co-pay amounts or contribute toward insurance
    premiums. Each of the participants and their spouses will
    continue to be covered under this plan upon retirement for life.
    The costs of the benefits under these plans are accrued during
    the years in which the employees provide service. The plans are
    not funded. In prior years, the Company used
    December&#160;31st&#160;as its measurement date for obligation
    and asset calculations. In 2008, in accordance with
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;158, the measurement date became the fiscal
    year end date of the Company and, as such, the plans were valued
    as of January&#160;31, 2009. Due to the adoption of the
    measurement provisions of SFAS&#160;No.&#160;158, the Company
    recorded an increase of approximately $0.1&#160;million to
    retained earnings.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In 2006, the Company reviewed its current practice related to
    the Company&#146;s coverage of costs related to its
    Postretirement Medical Plan. The Company concluded that the
    original intent of the plan was to charge participants exactly
    the expected actuarial cost to the Company. Over the last
    several years, the Company was in the practice of charging
    participants an amount that was less than the expected actuarial
    cost to the Company. As such, beginning in 2006 and over the
    following five years, the Company will gradually increase the
    amount charged to participants such that by the fifth year, the
    Company will be charging its participants an amount that fully
    offsets the actuarial projected liability.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table sets forth the changes in the benefit
    obligations and assets of the Company&#146;s Pension Plan, SERP
    and Postretirement Medical Plans as of January&#160;31, 2009 and
    February&#160;2, 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <BR>
    F-35

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table sets forth the funded status of the
    Company&#146;s Pension Plan, SERP, and Postretirement Medical
    Plans and the amounts recognized in the Company&#146;s
    consolidated balance sheets as of January&#160;31, 2009 and
    February&#160;2, 2008.

    The components of net&#160;SERP expenses are as follows:

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The components recognized in other comprehensive loss (income)
    for the Pension Plan, SERP, and Postretirement Medical Plans are
    as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    When funding is required for the Pension Plan, the
    Company&#146;s policy is to contribute amounts that are
    deductible for federal income tax purposes. During 2008, the
    Company was required to make contributions of
    $11.5&#160;million. During 2007, the Company was not required to
    make any contributions. During 2008 and 2007, the Company did
    not make any voluntary contributions to the Pension Plan. Based
    upon current available information, the Company will be required
    to make contributions of approximately $8.4&#160;million in 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Significant assumptions related to the Company&#146;s employee
    benefit plans include the discount rate used to calculate the
    actuarial present value of benefit obligations to be paid in the
    future, the expected long-term rate of return on assets held by
    the Pension Plan, the average rate of compensation increase by
    Pension Plan and SERP participants, and the health care cost
    trend annual rate for the Postretirement Medical Plans. These
    actuarial assumptions are reviewed annually based upon currently
    available information. The assumptions utilized by the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-38
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

    Company in calculating the projected benefit obligations and
    periodic expense of its employee benefit plans are as follows:

<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Pension Plan:</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The assumed discount rate utilized is based, in part, upon a
    discount rate modeling process that involves applying a
    methodology which matches the future benefit payment stream to a
    discount curve yield for the plan. The discount rate is utilized
    principally in calculating the actuarial present value of the
    Company&#146;s obligation and periodic expense pursuant to its
    employee benefits plans. To the extent the discount rate
    increases or decreases, the Company&#146;s Pension Plan, SERP,
    and Postretirement Medical Plans obligation is decreased or
    increased accordingly.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The assumed expected long-term rate of return on assets is the
    weighted average rate of earnings expected on the funds invested
    or to be invested to provide for the pension obligation. It is
    the Company&#146;s current target allocation to invest the
    Pension Plan assets in equity securities, including foreign
    securities (approximately 70&#160;percent) and fixed income
    securities (approximately 30&#160;percent). The Company does not
    allow the plan to invest in the Company&#146;s stock, AEON Co.,
    Ltd.&#146;s stock, or in the stock of soft goods retailers. The
    Company periodically evaluates the allocation between investment
    categories of the assets held by the Pension Plan. The expected
    average long-term rate of return on assets is based on an
    analysis which considers: actual net returns for the Pension
    Plan since inception, Ibbotson Associates historical investment
    returns data for the major classes of investments in which the
    Company invests (debt, equity, and foreign securities) for the
    period since the Pension Plan&#146;s inception and for the
    longer commencing periods when the return data was first
    tracked, and expectations of future market returns from outside
    sources for the two major classes of investments in which the
    Company invests. This rate is utilized primarily in estimating
    the expected return on plan assets component of the annual
    pension expense. To the extent
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-39
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    TALBOTS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    the actual rate of return on assets is less than or more than
    the assumed rate, that year&#146;s annual pension expense is not
    immediately affected. Rather, this loss or gain adjusts future
    pension expense over approximately five years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The market related value of plan assets is a calculated value
    that recognizes the changes in fair value by adjusting the
    current market value of plan assets by the difference between
    actual investment return versus expected investment return over
    the last five years at a rate of twenty percent per year. The
    market related value of plan assets is determined consistently
    for all classes of assets.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The assumed average rate of compensation increase is the average
    annual compensation increase expected over the remaining
    employment periods for the participating employees. This rate is
    utilized principally in estimating the pension obligation and
    annual pension expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Pension Plan&#146;s weighted average asset allocations at
    January&#160;31, 2009 and December&#160;31, 2007 by asset
    category are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Target<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company expects to contribute $1.3&#160;million and
    $0.1&#160;million to the SERP and the Postretirement Medical
    Plans, respectively, during 2009. The Company is required to
    contribute approximately $8.4&#160;million to the Pension Plan
    in 2009. The Company will not make any voluntary contributions
    to the Pension Plan during 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The estimated amount that will be amortized from AOCI into net
    periodic benefit cost in 2009 is as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
