<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.82 CHANGE IN CONTROL AGREEMENT - MICHAEL SCARPA
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w82</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.82
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">December&nbsp;4, 2008
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>THE TALBOTS, INC.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>CHANGE IN CONTROL AGREEMENT</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Michael Scarpa<BR>
c/o The Talbots, Inc.<BR>
One Talbots Drive<BR>
Hingham, Massachusetts 02043

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Dear Michael:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) reflects our mutual understanding regarding payments to be
made to, and benefits to be received by, you in the event your employment with The Talbots, Inc., a
Delaware corporation (including its subsidiaries, the &#147;Company&#148;), is terminated by the Company
within twelve (12)&nbsp;months following a Change in Control. This Agreement shall become effective on
your employment commencement date. The capitalized termed used in this Agreement that are not
otherwise defined herein shall have the meanings given to such terms in <U><B>Appendix&nbsp;A</B></U> hereto,
incorporated herein by this reference and hereby made a part hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;<U>Termination after Change In Control</U>. In the event that the Company terminates your
employment Without Cause within twelve (12)&nbsp;months after the occurrence of a Change in Control,
then the following shall occur:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company shall pay to you on the effective date of such termination: (i)
salary for services rendered up to and including the date of termination, (ii)&nbsp;any and
all compensation to which you may be entitled as of the date of termination pursuant to
The Talbots, Inc. 2003 Executive Stock Based Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) or any other
compensation or benefit plan to the extent permitted by such plans, and (iii)
reimbursement for outstanding ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred by you in
connection with the performance of your duties for the Company up to and including the
date on which your employment is terminated;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company shall pay to you, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the effective date
of such termination, an amount of severance pay equal to one times the sum of:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>your annual base salary at the rate in effect on the date of
such termination, and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>your &#147;target&#148; annual cash incentive bonus as then established
for you and determined in accordance with the applicable annual cash incentive
bonus arrangement in place from time to time (provided that the target annual
cash incentive bonus shall be no less than 100% of your annual base salary).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You shall continue to participate, on the same terms and conditions, in any benefit programs
of the Company in which you participated immediately prior to such termination (including, without
limitation, as applicable, any disability insurance benefit program, any medical insurance program,
and dental insurance program, and any life insurance program) from time of such termination until
the earlier of: (i)&nbsp;the end of the one (1)&nbsp;year period beginning from the effective date of the
termination of your employment, or (ii)&nbsp;such time as you are eligible to be covered by a comparable
program of a subsequent employer. You hereby agree to notify the Company promptly if and when you
begin employment with another employer and if and when you become eligible to participate in any
pension or other benefit plans, programs or arrangements of another employer.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;<U>Assignment</U>. None of the parties hereto shall, without the consent of the other,
assign or transfer this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder. This Agreement and all
of the provisions hereof shall be binding upon, and inure to the benefit of, the parties hereto,
and their successors (including successors by merger, consolidation or similar transactions),
permitted assigns, executors, administrators, personal representatives, heirs and distributees.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;<U>Miscellaneous</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>Entire Agreement</U>. This Agreement contains the entire understanding between and
among the parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any prior or
contemporaneous understandings and agreements, written or oral, between us respecting such subject
matter; <U>provided, however</U>, that this Agreement shall not be construed to impair or
otherwise adversely affect the grant of any Award (as such term is defined in the Plan) made to you
under the Plan or the related grant agreements, the Severance Agreement, and the Offer Letter,
between the Company and you and all of which remain in full force and effect. For as long as this
Agreement is in effect, to the degree there is any conflict between the severance payments and
benefit provisions to which you are then entitled under this Agreement and those of any other
written agreement which continues to be in effect between the Company and you, such conflict shall
be resolved by the Company in good faith by affording you the more favorable severance payments and
benefits contained in any such agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing herein relieves
you from the obligation to comply with the restrictive covenants of all such agreements or from the
consequences of noncompliance therewith regardless under which agreement the severance payments and
severance benefits may be deemed to have been made. Furthermore, for purposes of clarification
only, if you receive severance pay and benefits under one agreement, you shall not be entitled to
severance pay or benefits under any other agreement, plan or arrangement.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Governing Law</U>. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance
with the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts applicable to contracts made and to be wholly
performed in that state.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If this letter sets forth our agreement on the subject matter hereof, kindly sign, date and return
to The Talbots, Inc. the enclosed copy of this letter which will then constitute our binding
agreement on the subject.
</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD valign="top" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="left">Sincerely,<BR>
<BR>
THE TALBOTS, INC.<BR>
&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top">By:&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="2" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000" align="left">/s/ Trudy F. Sullivan
&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="2" align="left">Trudy F. Sullivan&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="2" align="left">President and Chief Executive Officer&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TR>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>Appendix&nbsp;A</B></U>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Definitions</B></U>. As used in the Change in Control Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Change in Control&#148; shall mean (i)&nbsp;the acquisition (including as a result of a
merger) by any &#147;person&#148; (as such term is used in Sections&nbsp;3(a)(9), 13(d) and 14(d) of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), or persons
&#147;acting in concert&#148; (which for purposes of this Agreement shall include two (2)&nbsp;or more
persons voting together on a consistent basis pursuant to an agreement or understanding
between them to act in concert and/or as a &#147;group&#148; within the meaning of Sections
13(d)(3) and 14(d)(2) of the Exchange Act), other than the Company or any of its
subsidiaries, and other than AEON (U.S.A.), Inc. or any of its subsidiaries or
&#147;affiliates&#148; (as such term is defined in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 under the Exchange Act)
(collectively, an &#147;Acquiring Person&#148;), of beneficial ownership (within the meaning of
Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the
Company representing more than 25&nbsp;percent of the combined voting power of the then
outstanding securities of the Company entitled to then vote generally in the election
of directors of the Company, and no other stockholder is the beneficial owner (within
the meaning of Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of a
percentage of such securities higher than that held by the Acquiring Person; or (ii)
individuals, who, as of the effective date of this Agreement (the &#147;Effective Date&#148;),
constitute the Board (the &#147;Incumbent Board&#148;) cease for any reason to constitute at
least a majority of the Board; provided that any individual becoming a director
subsequent to the Effective Date, whose election or nomination for election by the
Company&#146;s stockholders was approved by a vote of at least two-thirds of the directors
then comprising the Incumbent Board shall be considered as though such individual were
a member of the Incumbent Board, but excluding as a member of the Incumbent Board, any
such individual whose initial assumption of office is in connection with an actual or
threatened election contest relating to the election of the directors of the Company
(as such terms are used in Rule&nbsp;14a-11 of Regulation&nbsp;14A under the Exchange Act) and
further excluding any individual who is an &#147;affiliate&#148;, &#147;associate&#148; (as such terms are
defined in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 under the Exchange Act) or designee of an Acquiring Person having
or proposing to acquire beneficial ownership (within the meaning of Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under
the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing
more than 10&nbsp;percent of the combined voting power of the then outstanding securities of
the Company entitled to then vote generally in the election of directors of the
Company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Without Cause&#148; shall mean termination (I)&nbsp;by Talbots of your employment as a
result of an event or condition other than (i)&nbsp;your death, (ii)&nbsp;your inability
substantially to perform your employment duties as a result of physical or mental
illness or injury for a continuous periods of at least six months (any dispute as to
your incapacities shall be resolved by an independent physician, reasonably acceptable
to you or your legal representative and the Company&#146;s Board of Directors, whose
determination shall be final and binding upon you and the Company), (iii)&nbsp;any</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>material breach by you of this Agreement or any other agreement to which you and the
Company are both parties (which is not cured within 30&nbsp;days following written notice
from the Company), (iv)&nbsp;any act or omission to act by you which may have a material and
adverse effect on the Company&#146;s business or on your ability to perform services for the
Company, including, without limitation, the commission of any crime involving moral
turpitude or any felony, or (v)&nbsp;any material misconduct or material neglect of duties by
you in connection with the business or affairs of the Company, or (II)&nbsp;termination of
employment with the Company by you for Good Reason (which term &#147;Good Reason&#148; is defined
in your Severance Agreement with the Company dated December&nbsp;4, 2008).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.89 CHANGE IN CONTROL AGREEMENT - GREGORY I. POOLE
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w89</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.89
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>THE TALBOTS, INC.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>CHANGE IN CONTROL AGREEMENT</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Gregory I. Poole<BR>
EVP/Chief Supply Chain Officer<BR>
c/o The Talbots, Inc.<BR>
One Talbots Drive<BR>
Hingham, Massachusetts 02043

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Dear Greg:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) reflects our mutual understanding regarding payments to be
made to, and benefits to be received by, you in the event your employment with The Talbots, Inc., a
Delaware corporation (including its subsidiaries, the &#147;Company&#148;), is terminated by the Company
within twelve (12)&nbsp;months following a Change in Control. This Agreement shall become effective on
your employment commencement date. The capitalized termed used in this Agreement that are not
otherwise defined herein shall have the meanings given to such terms in <U><B>Appendix&nbsp;A</B></U> hereto,
incorporated herein by this reference and hereby made a part hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;<U>Termination after Change In Control</U>. In the event that the Company terminates your
employment Without Cause within twelve (12)&nbsp;months after the occurrence of a Change in Control,
then the following shall occur:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company shall pay to you on the effective date of such termination: (i)
salary for services rendered up to and including the date of termination, (ii)&nbsp;any and
all compensation to which you may be entitled as of the date of termination pursuant to
The Talbots, Inc. 2003 Executive Stock Based Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) or any other
compensation or benefit plan to the extent permitted by such plans, and (iii)
reimbursement for outstanding ordinary and reasonable expenses incurred by you in
connection with the performance of your duties for the Company up to and including the
date on which your employment is terminated;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company shall pay to you, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the effective date
of such termination, an amount of severance pay equal to one times the sum of:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>your annual base salary at the rate in effect on the date of
such termination, and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>your &#147;target&#148; annual cash incentive bonus as then established
for you and determined in accordance with the applicable annual cash incentive
bonus</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>arrangement in place from time to time (provided that the target annual cash
incentive bonus shall be no less than 75% of your annual base salary).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You shall continue to participate, on the same terms and conditions, in any benefit programs
of the Company in which you participated immediately prior to such termination (including, without
limitation, as applicable, any disability insurance benefit program, any medical insurance program,
and dental insurance program, and any life insurance program) from time of such termination until
the earlier of: (i)&nbsp;the end of the one (1)&nbsp;year period beginning from the effective date of the
termination of your employment, or (ii)&nbsp;such time as you are eligible to be covered by a comparable
program of a subsequent employer. You hereby agree to notify the Company promptly if and when you
begin employment with another employer and if and when you become eligible to participate in any
pension or other benefit plans, programs or arrangements of another employer.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;<U>Assignment</U>. None of the parties hereto shall, without the consent of the other,
assign or transfer this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder. This Agreement and all
of the provisions hereof shall be binding upon, and inure to the benefit of, the parties hereto,
and their successors (including successors by merger, consolidation or similar transactions),
permitted assigns, executors, administrators, personal representatives, heirs and distributees.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;<U>Miscellaneous</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>Entire Agreement</U>. This Agreement contains the entire understanding between and
among the parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any prior or
contemporaneous understandings and agreements, written or oral, between us respecting such subject
matter; <U>provided however</U>, that this Agreement shall not be construed to impair or otherwise
adversely affect the grant of any Award (as such term is defined in the Plan) hereafter made to you
under the Plan or the Restricted Stock Award Agreement, the Non-Qualified Stock Option Agreement,
the Severance Agreement, and the Offer Letter, each as effective as of an even date hereof between
Company and you and all of which remain in full force and effect. For as long as this Agreement
is in effect, to the degree there is any conflict between the severance payments and benefit
provisions to which you are then entitled under this Agreement and those of any other written
agreement which continues to be in effect between the Company and you, such conflict shall be
resolved by the Company in good faith by affording you the more favorable severance payments and
benefits contained in any such agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing herein relieves
you from the obligation to comply with the restrictive covenants of all such agreements or from the
consequences of noncompliance therewith regardless under which agreement the severance payments
and/or severance benefits may be deemed to have been made. Furthermore, for purposes of
clarification only, if you receive severance pay and benefits under one agreement, you shall not be
entitled to severance pay or benefits under any other agreement, plan or arrangement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Governing Law</U>. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance
with the laws of The Commonwealth of Massachusetts applicable to contracts made and to be wholly
performed in that state.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If this letter sets forth our agreement on the subject matter hereof, kindly sign, date and
return to The Talbots, Inc. the enclosed copy of this letter which will then constitute our binding
agreement on the subject.
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>Appendix&nbsp;A</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Definitions</B></U>. As used in the Change in Control Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Change in Control&#148; shall mean (i)&nbsp;the acquisition (including as a result of a
merger) by any &#147;person&#148; (as such term is used in Sections&nbsp;3(a)(9), 13(d) and 14(d) of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), or persons
&#147;acting in concert&#148; (which for purposes of this Agreement shall include two (2)&nbsp;or more
persons voting together on a consistent basis pursuant to an agreement or understanding
between them to act in concert and/or as a &#147;group&#148; within the meaning of Sections
13(d)(3) and 14(d)(2) of the Exchange Act), other than the Company or any of its
subsidiaries, and other than AEON (U.S.A.), Inc. or any of its subsidiaries or
&#147;affiliates&#148; (as such term is defined in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 under the Exchange Act)
(collectively, an &#147;Acquiring Person&#148;), of beneficial ownership (within the meaning of
Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the
Company representing more than 25&nbsp;percent of the combined voting power of the then
outstanding securities of the Company entitled to then vote generally in the election
of directors of the Company, and no other stockholder is the beneficial owner (within
the meaning of Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of a
percentage of such securities higher than that held by the Acquiring Person; or (ii)
individuals, who, as of the effective date of this Agreement (the &#147;Effective Date&#148;),
constitute the Board (the &#147;Incumbent Board&#148;) cease for any reason to constitute at
least a majority of the Board; provided that any individual becoming a director
subsequent to the Effective Date, whose election or nomination for election by the
Company&#146;s stockholders was approved by a vote of at least two-thirds of the directors
then comprising the Incumbent Board shall be considered as though such individual were
a member of the Incumbent Board, but excluding as a member of the Incumbent Board, any
such individual whose initial assumption of office is in connection with an actual or
threatened election contest relating to the election of the directors of the Company
(as such terms are used in Rule&nbsp;14a-11 of Regulation&nbsp;14A under the Exchange Act) and
further excluding any individual who is an &#147;affiliate&#148;, &#147;associate&#148; (as such terms are
defined in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 under the Exchange Act) or designee of an Acquiring Person having
or proposing to acquire beneficial ownership (within the meaning of Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under
the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing
more than 10&nbsp;percent of the combined voting power of the then outstanding securities of
the Company entitled to then vote generally in the election of directors of the
Company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Without Cause&#148; shall mean termination by Talbots of your employment as a
result of an event or condition other than (i)&nbsp;your death, (ii)&nbsp;your inability
substantially to perform your employment duties as a result of physical or mental
illness or injury for a continuous period of at least six months (any dispute as to
your incapacities shall be resolved by an independent physician, reasonably acceptable
to you or your legal representative and the Company&#146;s Board of Directors, whose
determination shall be final and binding upon you and the Company), (iii)&nbsp;any material
breach by you of this</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Agreement or any other agreement to which you and the Company are both parties (which is
not cured within 45&nbsp;days following written notice from the Company), (iv)&nbsp;any act or
omission to act by you which may have a material and adverse effect on the Company&#146;s
business or on your ability to perform services for the Company, including, without
limitation, the commission of any crime involving moral turpitude or any felony, or (v)
any material misconduct or material neglect of duties by you in connection with the
business or affairs of the Company.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->

<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.97 FORM OF 409A LETTER AGREEMENT
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w97</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.97
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 70%">December&nbsp;19, 2008

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#091;Name&#093;<BR>
&#091;Title&#093;<BR>
c/o The Talbots, Inc.<BR>
One Talbots Drive<BR>
Hingham, MA 02043

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Re: <U>CODE SECTION 409A AMENDMENT</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dear &#091;Name&#093;,
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to comply with final regulations issued under Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue
Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;), you and The Talbots, Inc. (including its subsidiaries, the
&#147;Company&#148;) hereby agree that, notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any severance agreement
or severance arrangement between you and the Company (all collectively referred to herein as the
&#147;agreements&#148;), it is the intention of the parties that each of such agreements comply with Code
Section&nbsp;409A, and any regulations or other guidance issued thereunder, and the agreements and the
payments of any benefits thereunder will be operated and administered accordingly. Specifically,
but not by limitation, you agree that if, at the time of termination of your employment, the
Company is considered to be publicly traded and you are considered to be a specified employee, as
defined in Code Section&nbsp;409A (and as determined as of December&nbsp;31 preceding your termination of
employment, unless your termination of employment occurs prior to April&nbsp;1, in which case the
determination will be made as of the second preceding December&nbsp;31), then some or all of such
payments to be made under any of such agreements as a result of your termination of employment will
be deferred for no more than six (6)&nbsp;months following such termination of employment, if and to the
extent the delay in such payments is necessary in order to comply with the requirements of Code
Section&nbsp;409A after utilizing the short-term deferral and involuntary separation pay plan exemptions
(if applicable). Upon expiration of such six month period (or, if earlier, your death), any
payments so withheld will be distributed to you, with a payment of interest thereon credited at a
rate of prime plus 1% (with such prime rate to be determined as of the actual payment date). The
foregoing is hereby incorporated into and made a part of the agreements.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#091;Name&#093;, kindly sign and return a copy of this agreement to my attention <U>by December&nbsp;31,
2008</U> to indicate your acceptance of the above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Very truly yours,
</DIV>

<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.98 OFFER LETTER - MICHAEL SMALDONE
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w98</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.98
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">December&nbsp;13, 2007
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B><I>By Overnight Mail</I></B></U><BR>
Michael Smaldone<BR>
&#091;Home Address&#093;

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dear Michael,

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">On behalf of The Talbots, Inc. (including its subsidiaries, &#147;Talbots&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;) and subject
to review and approval by the Company&#146;s Board of Directors, we are pleased to offer you the
position of Chief Creative Officer, Talbots Brand in accordance with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Base Salary, Signing Bonus, Benefits and Perquisites</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Your initial salary will be at the rate of $725,000 per annum. Your salary will be paid to
you on a bi-weekly basis. Your first review for a possible salary increase based on
demonstrated job performance will be scheduled for the first quarter of FY 2009 and annually
thereafter.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You will receive a $150,000 signing bonus, payable as of your employment start date and an
additional $250,000 signing bonus, payable as of March&nbsp;31, 2008. If you voluntarily leave
Talbots or resign other than for Good Reason (as defined below) or your employment is
terminated by Talbots for Cause (as defined below) in your first year of employment, you will
be required to reimburse the Company for this $400,000.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You will be immediately eligible to participate in all benefit plans generally available at
the time to Talbots senior executives, subject to plan terms and customary eligibility
conditions. Plans are subject to modification or termination by the Company in its
discretion. Included in your benefit package is an annual vacation benefit of four weeks.
You will also be eligible for all perquisites at a level commensurate with the executive vice
president level at Talbots, including an auto allowance, reimbursement of financial planning
expenses and a change in control agreement in the form of <U><B>Exhibit&nbsp;A</B></U>. Perquisites will
not be grossed up for taxes.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You will report directly to the President and Chief Executive Officer and your start date
will be a date within 30&nbsp;days of the date of this letter as mutually established by you and
the Company.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>Annual Incentive Award Opportunity</I></B>

</DIV>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You will be eligible for participation in the Company&#146;s incentive plan commencing in FY
2008. Your target award opportunity under the Company&#146;s incentive plan will be 50% of your
base salary. There will be no bonus paid to you for the partial FY 2007. For FY 2008 only,
you will receive a minimum bonus equal to $362,500 (which equals your target award opportunity
for FY 2008). This $362,500 bonus payment (payable in the second quarter of 2009 at the same
time as other FY 2008 bonuses would customarily be paid to other senior Company officers) is
guaranteed and will be paid to you whether or not the Company&#146;s performance goals under the
Company&#146;s 2008 incentive plan are achieved, unless you voluntarily leave Talbots or resign
other than for Good Reason (as defined below) or your employment is terminated by Talbots for
Cause (as defined below) prior to the date that FY 2008 bonuses are paid to senior Company
officers.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Equity Compensation</I></B>

you will be subject to the terms of the Plan.</TD>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

will be awarded a one-time restricted stock award for 35,000 shares of Common Stock of the
Company, $0.01 par value per share (&#147;Common Stock&#148;) pursuant to and subject to the terms and
conditions of a Restricted Stock Award Agreement in the form of <U><B>Exhibit&nbsp;B</B></U>, to be
executed by the Company and you. This restricted stock award will be effective on your
employment commencement date and will vest in one-quarter annual increments beginning one year
from the effective date of the award.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

15,000 shares of Common Stock upon your joining the Company in the form of <U><B>Exhibit&nbsp;C</B></U>.
The option price will be equal to the closing stock price on the grant date which will be your
employment commencement date. The option will vest in one-third annual increments beginning
one year from the effective date of the award.</TD>
</TR>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

restricted stock awards to you will be subject to Compensation Committee&#146;s sole discretion.</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>Severance</I></B>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>It is understood and agreed that either you or Talbots may terminate the employment
relationship at any time and for any reason upon giving thirty days&#146; prior written notice.
Your eligibility for severance benefits will be pursuant to and subject to the terms and
conditions of the Severance Agreement being executed between you and the Company at the same
time and attached hereto as <U><B>Exhibit&nbsp;D</B></U> (the &#147;Severance Agreement&#148;). Subject to the
terms of such Agreement, in the event of a termination of your employment by the Company
without Cause or by you for &#147;good reason&#148;, you would be entitled to receive 1.5 times your
annual base salary and 18&nbsp;months benefits continuation, subject to the Company&#146;s receipt of a
release and waiver.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Restrictive Covenants</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Confidentiality</U>. You agree that you will not, at any time during or following your
employment, directly or indirectly, without the express prior written consent of the Company,
disclose or use any Confidential Information of the Company. &#147;Confidential Information&#148; will
include all information concerning the Company or any parent, subsidiary, affiliate, employee,
customer or supplier or other business associate of the Company or any affiliate (including
but not limited to any trade secrets or other confidential, proprietary or private matters),
which has been or is received by you from the Company, or from any parent, subsidiary,
affiliate or customer or supplier or other business associate of the Company or developed by
you during the term of your employment, and which is not known or generally available to the
public.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Non-Disparagement</U>. You agree that, for a period of one year after termination or
cessation of your employment for any reason, you will not take action or make any statement,
written or oral, which is intended to materially disparage the Company or its business.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Non-Solicitation</U>.You agree that, for a period of one year after the termination or
cessation of your employment for any reason, you will not directly or indirectly solicit,
attempt to hire, or hire any employee of the Company (or any person who may have been employed
by the Company during the last year of your employment with the Company), or actively assist
in such hiring by any other person or business entity
or encourage, induce or attempt to induce any such employee to terminate his or her employment
with the Company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Non-Competition</U>. You agree that throughout the term of your employment, and for a
period of eighteen (18)&nbsp;months after termination or cessation of employment for any reason,
you will not engage in, participate in, carry on, own, or manage, directly or indirectly,
either for yourself or as a partner, stockholder, investor, officer, director, employee,
agent, independent contractor, representative or consultant of any person,</TD>
</TR>


</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Michael Smaldone<BR>
December&nbsp;13, 2007<BR>
Page 4

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>partnership, corporation or other enterprise, in any &#147;Competitive Business&#148; (defined below) in
any jurisdiction in which the Company actively conducts business.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Competitive Business&#148; means:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) a women&#146;s retail and/or catalog apparel business; or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) any other retail or catalog business that competes with any significant business
of the Company then conducted or actively being developed by the Company; for this purpose,
&#147;significant business of the Company&#148; means a business, product line or product category
which generates or is reasonably expected to generate $100&nbsp;million or more in annual sales.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>As of the date of this agreement, a Competitive Business would include, by way of illustration
and not by way of limitation, such companies as Ann Taylor, Gap Inc., Chico&#146;s FAS, J. Crew, Liz
Claiborne, Limited Brands, Coldwater Creek, Polo Ralph Lauren, and Coach, Inc. (and any of
their affiliated brands, subsidiaries or successors). This list is not meant to be exhaustive
and will likely change and expand over time<B>.</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Your engaging in the following activities will not be deemed to be engaging or participating in
a Competitive Business: (i)&nbsp;investment banking; (ii)&nbsp;passive ownership of less than 2% of any
class of securities of a company; and (iii)&nbsp;engaging or participating solely in a
noncompetitive business of an entity which also separately operates a business which is a
&#147;Competitive Business&#148;.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You acknowledge, with the advice of legal counsel, that you understand the foregoing provisions
of this non-competition agreement, that it is binding and enforceable against you, and that
these provisions are fair, reasonable, and necessary for the protection of the Company&#146;s
business.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In addition to all other rights and remedies of the Company under this offer letter or
otherwise, upon a material breach of any of the restrictive covenants set forth under
the &#147;<U>Non-Solicitation</U>&#148; and &#147;<U>Non-Competition</U>&#148; provisions above, which is not
cured within 30&nbsp;days following written notice to you from the Company, the Company will have
the right to terminate any severance payment and benefits provided pursuant to this offer
letter (including all related agreements) or any other or successor severance agreement
covering you.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Definition</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Cause&#148; will have the meaning set forth in the Severance Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Good Reason&#148; will have the meaning set forth in the Severance Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Michael Smaldone<BR>
December&nbsp;13, 2007<BR>
Page 5

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>Arbitration; Mediation</I></B>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any dispute, controversy or claim between the parties arising out of or relating to this
offer letter or all related agreements referenced herein, will be settled by arbitration
conducted in The Commonwealth of Massachusetts (before a single arbitrator who shall be a
former federal or state court judge), in accordance with the Commercial Rules of the American
Arbitration Association then in force, provided, however, you acknowledge that in the event of
a violation of the restrictive covenants set forth above, the Company may suffer irreparable
damages and the Company will be entitled to seek to obtain from a state or federal court in
The Commonwealth of Massachusetts or a federal or state court of any other state or
jurisdiction, temporary, preliminary or permanent injunctive relief (without the necessity of
posting any bond or other security), which rights will be in addition to any other rights or
remedies to which it may be entitled. You hereby irrevocably consent to the exclusive
jurisdiction of any federal court or state court located in The Commonwealth of Massachusetts,
and you hereby agree that process in any suit, action or proceeding may be served anywhere in
the world in the same manner as provided for notices to a party as provided in the Severance
Agreement. Moreover, nothing in this provision prevents you from filing, cooperating with, or
participating in any proceeding before the EEOC or a state Fair Employment Practices Agency
relating to discrimination or bias (except that you acknowledge that you may not recover any
monetary benefits in connection with any such proceeding). The decision of the arbitrator
conducting any such arbitration proceedings will be in writing, will set forth the basis
therefore and such arbitrator&#146;s decision or award will be final and binding upon the Company
and you. The Company and you will abide by all awards rendered in such arbitration
proceedings, and all such awards may be enforced and executed upon in any court having
jurisdiction over the party against whom or which enforcement of such award is sought.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Company and you agree that, prior to submitting a dispute
under this offer letter to arbitration, the parties agree to submit, for a period of sixty
(60)&nbsp;days, to voluntary mediation before a jointly selected neutral third party mediator under
the auspices of JAMS, Boston, Massachusetts, Resolution Center (or any successor location),
pursuant to the procedures of JAMS International Mediation Rules conducted in The Commonwealth
of Massachusetts (however, such mediation or obligation to mediate will not suspend or
otherwise delay any termination or other action of the Company or affect the Company&#146;s other
rights).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Taxes</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All payments will be subject to rules under Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;409A. If any
payment is withheld from you for Section&nbsp;409A compliance purposes, such payment will be distributed
to you following the expiration of the applicable period, with a payment of
interest thereon credited at a rate of prime plus 1% (with such prime rate to be determined as of
the actual payment date); provided, however, that any payment of interest will be made only if and to
the extent such payment is</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>consistent with Section&nbsp;409A and any regulations and other guidance issued thereunder.</TD>
</TR>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B><I>Miscellaneous</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This offer letter together with all related agreements referenced herein (collectively, the
&#147;Documents&#148;) constitute the entire understanding between you and the Company and cannot be
modified, altered or waived unless it is done in a writing signed by both you and the Company.
If there is any conflict between the terms of these Documents and any other document related
to your employment, the terms of these Documents will control. This offer letter is governed
by the laws of The Commonwealth of Massachusetts (other than its rules for conflicts of laws).
This offer letter is personal in nature to the Company and your rights and obligations under
this offer letter may not be assigned by you. This offer letter will be binding upon and
inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their successors (including successors by
merger, consolidation, sale or similar transaction, permitted assigns, executors,
administrators, personal representatives, and heirs).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>It is the intention of the parties that the provisions of this offer letter will be
enforced to the fullest extent permissible under the laws and public policies of each state
and jurisdiction in which such enforcement is sought, but that the unenforceability (or the
modification to conform with such laws or public policies) of any provisions hereof, will not
render unenforceable or impair the remainder of this offer letter. Accordingly, if any
provision of this offer letter will be determined to be invalid or unenforceable, either in
whole or in part, this offer letter will be deemed amended to delete or modify, as necessary,
the offending provisions and to alter the balance of this offer letter in order to render the
same valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permissible.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>By accepting this offer, you represent that you are not under any obligation or covenant to
any former employer or any person, firm or corporation, which would prevent, limit or impair
in any way the performance by you of your duties as an employee of Talbots. You have also
provided to the Company a true copy of any non-competition obligation or agreement to which
you may be subject.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You represent that the information (written or oral) provided to the Company by you or your
representatives in connection with obtaining employment or in connection with your former
employments, work history, circumstances of leaving your former employments and educational
background is true and complete.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This offer is effective only through Friday, December&nbsp;14, 2007 and is contingent upon a
satisfactory background check. If you wish to accept our offer as outlined above, please sign
and return this letter to me. The enclosed copy is for your records.</TD>
</TR>


</TABLE>
</DIV>
